intro: Stenopadus jauensis, commonly known as the Jauensis stenopadus, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique leaf structure, which features a narrow, elongated shape with a distinct midrib. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
